title: How to Easily Locate the Largest Files on Your Mac Computer

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. It’s the Apple icon in the top left of the menu bar. [1] X Research source This method locates and deletes large documents. You can also save space by deleting the cookies in your web browser .

steps.title: Select System Settings.
steps.content: Select System Settings . This will open the System Settings menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click General.
steps.content: Click General . This is an option in the sidebar, and it has a gear icon on a gray background. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Storage.
steps.content: Click Storage . This is an option on the right. You’ll see categories of files on your Mac. Their total storage space usage will be listed next to the info button. [4] X Research source This is also a good time to assess whether you want to move some storage to a USB drive or external hard drive .

steps.title: Click Documents.
steps.content: Click Documents . This will open a list of your Mac’s document files.

steps.title: Click Large Files.
steps.content: Click Large Files . This tab will show you the largest files on your Mac. You can sort by size by clicking the Size header above the list of documents.

steps.title: Delete documents.
steps.content: Delete documents. To do so: Click the document to select it. Click Delete .

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. It’s the Apple icon in the top left of the menu bar. [5] X Research source If you’re doing a general Apple device cleanup, check out our guide on freeing up space on your iPhone too!

steps.title: Click About This Mac.
steps.content: Click About This Mac .

steps.title: Select Storage.
steps.content: Select Storage . This tab will show you general information about your Mac’s storage usage.

steps.title: Choose Manage.
steps.content: Choose Manage . This button is in the Storage tab. This will open a window with categories of files on your Mac in the sidebar.

steps.title: Click Documents.
steps.content: Click Documents . This will show you every document on your device. You can sort by size by clicking the Size header at the top of the list. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Delete documents.
steps.content: Delete documents. To do so: Click the document to select it. Click Delete .

steps.title: Enter a search term.
steps.content: Enter a search term. In a Finder window, enter a keyword in the top right search bar. This method allows you to filter files by size and type. [7] X Research source If you don’t have a specific search term, you can just start typing — the filter bar will appear automatically. Then, delete whatever you typed.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . This is located below the search box.

steps.title: Select Kind.
steps.content: Select Kind . This is located in the pop-up menu to the left, below the search bar. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select Document.
steps.content: Select Document . Choose this option in the box next to “Kind is”.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + .

steps.title: Click the second type drop-down and change it to Other.
steps.content: Click the second type drop-down and change it to Other .

steps.title: Select File Size.
steps.content: Select File Size . Choose this option in the pop-up window. You can use the attribute search bar to find it quickly.

steps.title: Change “equals” to “is greater than”.
steps.content: Change “equals” to “is greater than”. This will search for files bigger than a certain size.

steps.title: Select a file size.
steps.content: Select a file size. A good starting size is 100 to 200 MB. You’ll see large files, like videos and slide decks.

steps.title: Browse the files.
steps.content: Browse the files. After completing the filters, you’ll see the results below in the Finder window right away.

steps.title: Delete documents.
steps.content: Delete documents. To do so: Right-click the document to open its options menu. Click Move to Trash .
